info.name: Content Delivery API - Contentstack
info.description:
The Content Delivery API (CDA), available at [cdn.contentstack.com](https://cdn.contentstack.com), is a read-only API used to retrieve content from your Contentstack account and deliver it to your web or mobile properties.

The Contentstack CDA Postman Collection is a set of preconfigured REST API requests that will make it easy for you to get started with the [Contentstack Delivery APIs](https://www.contentstack.com/docs/developers/apis/content-delivery-api/) and try out our API requests through the [Postman](https://www.getpostman.com/) REST client.

**Postman Collection Details**

- CDA Postman Collection Version: 1.0.0
- Last Updated: June 26, 2020

request.description:
This call returns comprehensive information of all the content types available in a particular stack in your account.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the All Content Types API Reference document

query.description: Set this to 'true' to include in response the total count of content types available in your stack.

request.description:
This call returns information of a specific content type. It returns the content type schema, but does not include its entries.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Single Content Type API Reference document

This call returns comprehensive information of all the global fields available in a particular stack in your account.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the All Global Fields API Reference document

This request allows you to fetch comprehensive details of a specific global field.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Single Global Field API Reference document

The Get all entries call fetches the list of all the entries of a particular content type. It also returns the content of each entry in JSON format. You can also specify the environment and locale of which you wish to get the entries.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the All Entries API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.

request.description:
The Get a single entry request fetches a particular entry of a content type. 

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Single Entry API Reference document

query.description:
Using Delivery Tokens 
Fetches only published contentEnvironment parameter in the query is mandatoryFetches content of entry/entries published of the specified environmentVersion is optional.When no version is specified, it fetches the latest published versionIf a version is specified which is not the latest published version, it will not return any resultLocale is optionalWhen no locale is specified, it returns the entry from the master localeSpecify a locale in the query to get entry/entries of a particular locale
Using Access Token
Fetches published as well as non-published (draft) entriesEnvironment is optionalWhen specified, it fetches content of entry/entries published on the specified environment.Version is optionalWhen no version is specified, it returns the latest versionTo retrieve a specific version, specify the version number under this parameter. In such a case, DO NOT specify any environment.Locale is optionalWhen no locale is specified, it returns the entry from the master localeSpecify a locale to get entry/entries of only a particular locale
Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.

request.description:
This call fetches the list of all the assets of a particular stack. It also returns the content of each asset in JSON format. You can also specify the environment of which you wish to get the assets.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the All Assets API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment if you wish to retrieve the assets published in a particular environment.
Enter 'true' to include the relative URLs of the assets in the response.
Enter 'true' to include the dimensions (height and width) of the image in the response. Supported image types: JPG, GIF, PNG, WebP, BMP, TIFF, SVG, and PSD.

request.description:
This call fetches the latest version of a specific asset of a particular stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Single Asset API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment if you wish to retrieve the assets published in a particular environment.

Specify the version number of the asset that you wish to retrieve. If the version is not specified, the details of the latest version will be retrieved. To retrieve a specific version, keep the environment parameter blank.
Enter 'true' to include the dimensions (height and width) of the image in the response. Supported image types: JPG, GIF, PNG, WebP, BMP, TIFF, SVG, and PSD.
Enter 'true' to include the relative URLs of the assets in the response.

request.description:
The Initial Sync request syncs the entries and assets of a stack, published on a specific environment.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Initial Synchronization API Reference document

query.description: Enter ‘true’ to perform a complete sync of all your app data.
Enter the environment to retrieve and sync the content published on a specific environment.
Enter the content type UID, if you want to sync entries of specific content types.
Enter the locale to retrieve and sync the content published on a specific locale.
Specify the start date, if you want to retrieve and sync data starting from a specific date.
Enter the type(s) of content you want to retrieve and sync. You can pass multiple types as comma-separated values.

request.description:
When running the Initial Synchronization or the Subsequent Sync request, if the result of the sync (initial or subsequent) request exceeds 100 records you will get a pagination_token.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Sync using pagination token API Reference document

query.description: Enter the pagination token that you received in the response body of the previous sync process.

request.description:
The Subsequent Sync request is used to retrieve the updated content (i.e., published or unpublished content, or any published content that has been deleted) since the last performed complete Sync.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Subsequent Sync API Reference document

query.description: Enter the sync token that you received in the response body of the previous completed Synchronization process to get the delta updates

request.description:
Get entries containing the field values matching the condition in the query.

This query will work for both entries as well as assets.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Equals Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries where the value of a field within a Group field matches the condition in the query. This query is specifically for fields that are part of the Group field.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Equals Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries where the value of a field within a Modular Blocks field matches the condition in the query. This query is specifically for fields that are part of the Modular Blocks field.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Equals Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get all the entries in which the value of a field does not match the value provided in the condition.

This query will work for both entries as well as assets.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Not-equals Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.

Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries is which the value of a field matches to any of the given values. This parameter will compare field values of entries to that of the values provided in the condition.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Array Equals Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries where the value of a field, within a Group field, matches any of the given values. This parameter will compare field values of entries to that of the values provided in the condition. This query is specifically for fields that are part of the Group field.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Array Equals Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.

item.name: Array Equals Operator Within Modular Blocks

request.description:
Get entries where the value of a field within Modular Blocks matches to any of the given values. This query is specifically for fields that are part of any block within a Modular Block field.

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.

Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get all entries in which the value of a field does not match to any of the given values. This parameter will compare field values of entries to that of the values provided in the condition, and the query will retrieve entries that have field values that does not match to any of the values provided.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Array Not-equals Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

Get entries in which the value of a field does not match any of the values provided in the condition. This query is specifically for fields that are part of the Group field.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Array Not-equals Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

item.name: Array Not-equals Operator Within Modular Blocks

request.description:
Get entries where the values of the fields within Modular Blocks match the condition in the query. This query is specifically for fields that are part of any block within a Modular Block field.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Array Not-equals Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
When fetching an entry, the content of referred entries that are part of the parent entry is NOT included in the Response body; you only get their UIDs. To include the content of the referred entries in your response, you need to use the include[] parameter and specify the UID of the reference field as value.

The API request should be as follows:

https://cdn.contentstack.io/v3/content_types/product/entries?include[]={reference_field_UID}

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Include Reference API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
In case the referenced entry further has reference to another entry (nested referencing), you can use the dot operator to fetch the content of the nested references as well.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Include Reference API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
If the reference field is part of a Modular Blocks field, you need to use the Modular Blocks UID, Block UID, as well as the reference field UID using a dot operator.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Include Reference API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries having values based on referenced fields. This query retrieves all entries that satisfy the query conditions made on referenced fields.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Reference Search Equals API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries having values based on referenced fields. This query retrieves all entries that satisfy query conditions made on referenced fields.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Reference Search Equals API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

item.name: Reference Search Equals Within Modular Blocks

request.description:
Get entries having values based on referenced fields. This query retrieves all entries that satisfy query conditions made on referenced fields.

If the reference is part of a Modular Blocks field, you need to mention the Modular Blocks UID, Block UID, as well as the reference field UID using a dot operator

Note that this query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Reference Search Equals API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries having values based on referenced fields. This query works the opposite of $in_query and retrieves all entries that does not satisfy query conditions made on referenced fields.

Note that this query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Reference Search Not-equals API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries having values based on referenced fields. This query works the opposite of $in_query and retrieves all entries that does not satisfy query conditions made on referenced fields.

Note that this query will work for entries only.

If the reference is part of a Group field, you need to use the Group field UID as well as the reference field UID using a dot operator.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Reference Search Not-equals API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

item.name: Reference Search Not-equals Within Modular Blocks

request.description:
Get entries having values based on referenced fields. This query works the opposite of $in_query and retrieves all entries that does not satisfy query conditions made on referenced fields.

Note that this query will work for entries only.

If the reference is part of a Modular Blocks field, you need to use the Modular Blocks UID, Block UID, as well as the reference field UID using a dot operator.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Reference Search Not-equals API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries by using regular expressions to query fields of a content type. These regex queries will help to retrieve all the entries of a content type that have field values matching the condition provided in the query parameter.

This query will work for both entries as well as assets.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Search by Regex API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries by using regular expressions to query fields of a Group field. These regex queries will help to retrieve all the entries of a content type that have field values matching the condition provided in the query parameter.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Search by Regex API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

item.name: Search by Regex Within Modular Blocks

request.description:
Get entries by using regular expressions to query fields of a Modular Block. These regex queries will help to retrieve all the entries of a content type that have field values matching the condition provided in the query parameter.

This query will work for entries only and works specifically for fields that are part of any block within a Modular Block field.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Search by Regex API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries that satisfy all the conditions provided in the '$and' query.

This query will work for both entries as well as assets.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the AND Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries that satisfy all the conditions provided in the $and query.

This query is specifically for entries and works on fields that are part of the Group field.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the AND Operator API Reference document

request.description:
The limit parameter will return a specific number of entries in the output. So for example, if the content type contains more than 100 entries and you wish to fetch only the first 2 entries, you need to specify '2' as value in this parameter.

This query will work for both entries as well as assets.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Limit API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the maximum number of entries to be returned.

request.description:
The skip parameter will skip a specific number of entries in the output. So, for example, if the content type contains around 12 entries and you want to skip the first 2 entries to get only the last 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

This query will work for both entries as well as assets.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Skip API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the number of entries to be skipped.

request.description:
When fetching entries, you can sort them in the ascending order with respect to the value of a specific field in the response body.

This query will work for both entries as well as assets.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.

request.description:
Get entries if value of the field, mentioned in the condition, exists.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Exists API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
The only[][] parameter will include the data of only the specified fields for each entry and exclude the data of all other fields. There are two approaches to this parameter. Firstly, we have the only[BASE][] parameter, where 'BASE' is the default value and refers to the top-level fields of the schema. Secondly, we have the only[Reference_field_uid][] parameter, where you need to enter the UID of the reference field in place of "Reference_field_uid".

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Only Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries in which the data of a specific field is included in the response JSON.

This query is specifically for entries and works on fields that are part of the Group field.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Only Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries in which the data of a specific field is included in the response JSON.

This query is specifically for fields that are part of any block within a Modular Block field.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Only Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
The except[][] parameter will exclude the data of the specified fields for each entry and will include the data of the rest of the fields. There are two approaches to this parameter. Firstly, we have the except[BASE][] parameter, where 'BASE' is the default value and refers to the top-level fields of the schema. Secondly, we have the except[Reference_field_uid][] parameter, where you need to enter the UID of the reference field in place of Reference_field_uid.

This query will work for entries only.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Exclude Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.

request.description:
Get entries in which the data of a specific field is excluded from the response JSON, but the data of the rest of the fields are included.

This query is specifically for entries and works with fields that are part of the Group field.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Exclude Operator API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.

request.description:
Get entries in which the data of a specific field is excluded from the response JSON, but the data of the rest of the fields are included.

This query is specifically for entries and works with fields that are part of any block within a Modular Block field.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.

request.description:
To retrieve the count of entries, we have two parameters: include_count (retrieves entries' details and their count) and count (retrieves only the count of entries).

This query will work for both entries as well as assets.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Count API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment of which the entries needs to be included.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Enter 'true' to get the total count of the entries.

request.description:
The 'Get all entries' API request returns only the first 100 entries of the specified content type. Similarly, the 'Get all assets' request fetches the first 100 assets of a particular stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to use the Delivery Token of the respective environment.
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Pagination API Reference document

query.description: Enter the name of the environment to fetch the entries published on a particular environment.
Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.
Set this parameter to 'true' to include in response the total count of entries available in a content type.
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve entries. This query should be in JSON format.
Enter the maximum number of entries to be returned.
